file_content.text: Boy, this is some ship the Jedi got you. Makes me wish I had the Force. Except for the "no emotions" thing.
I checked out the engine--she was running a little hot, so I made some adjustments. Hope you don't mind.
This ship has served me well. I'd like to keep it in top condition, if you're willing to help.
I appreciate any assistance.
Glad to hear it. I've got a bad habit of doing without asking.
Have you always been this handy with machines?
You're quite a tinkerer.
Since I was a tyke. It's just neat, knowing how everything works.
Keep your hands to yourself. You're not part of my crew.
Don't do it again.
I'll put her back the way she was, but don't come crying when she shorts out.
If it runs, guzzles or hums, I can't help taking it apart. Used to drive my wife crazy. Still does, when I'm home.
Once, during shore leave, I tried to convert our freezer into a tankless water heater. Was she mad!
It must be difficult, being away from the people you love.
Do you miss her?
Don't think about it. That's the trick. Especially when you're alone.
I didn't know you had a wife. How long have you been together?
You're married?
Since before the Protectors. Used to do maintenance at a swoop track, and she sold snacks to the crowd.
I'd be mad, too!
If Doc did anything like that, he'd be sleeping on the floor for a week.
Oh, he knows. We've traded a few war stories already.
She never sees you, and when you are home, you break her things?
Have you two met? Because that is a dead-on impression.
Wives are nothing but trouble.
At least she doesn't have the Force. Try living with that.
No thanks. I'd rather observe and pity you from afar.
Marriage is a dead end. No one's going to tie me down.
Meet the right person, and they might change your mind.
It's hard sometimes, being away from her. But even she says I've got a gift. And I'm a good engineer, too.
You get it? Because she... well, your medic liked it. Good talking to you.
Listen. That's the sound of a perfectly optimized hyperdrive. I love this ship.
